div.div: Western Plains USD 106 is a school district located in Ness County, Kansas. USD 106 is comprised of the towns of Arnold, Brownell, Bazine, Ransom, and Utica. At Western Plains, we pride ourselves on the ability to serve each student and help them reach their potential with a highly qualified faculty in the comfort of well-maintained facilities. We are proud of what we do at Western Plains and invite you to check out the site. Thanks for visiting!

Leann's Photos would like you to know that spring picture proofs are available online at www.leannsphotos.com.
Here is a direct link: https://www.leannsphotos.com/?fbclid=IwAR0WEc2aRep7lMHJ_2EwdIiPnWSuNcscVcSurCFDqZD0OcxI98GEBwntlmI
Photos can be shipped to you for a shipping fee of $4.00. Ordering is open until May 31st.
You will need a password to view your child's photos. Please contact the school . . .

h3.a: Junior high musicians perform at LaCrosse Music Festival

div.p:
The LaCrosse Music Festival was held on March 6. Four musicians from Western Plains Junior High performed solos. Their hard work and dedication was rewarded with strong ratings, plus a great educational experience. Those students from WPJH included:
Kalihan Flax -- flute -- I rating
Madelyn Kraus -- alto saxophone -- I rating
Ana Luna -- flute -- I rating
Jonathan Solis -- trumpet -- II rating
The students are . . .

h3.a: Speech and drama department qualifies competitors for State, prepares school play

div.p:
The speech and drama department at Western Plains High School is in the midst of several very busy months, as competitors prepare and polish Forensics pieces and work to memorize lines and blocking cues for the annual school play.
Back in January, the Forensics season got underway with the first meet of the year. Since then, the team has traveled in many different directions to compete with their pieces. The team also . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Speech and drama department qualifies competitors for State, prepares school play

h3.a: Lynch cultivates minds of the youth

div.p:
RANSOM- Western Plains is proud to have numerous talented and hardworking teachers and support staff. One person that has truly made a difference in the school is Amy Lynch.
Lynch grew up in Ransom and recently moved back to her hometown in 2017. Lynch is now a paraprofessional for kindergarten and first grade at Western Plains North.
Not only is she a para, but she is also involved with many school and community . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Lynch cultivates minds of the youth

h3.a: Flax continues to strive after high school

div.p:
RANSOM- Since the consolidation of Western Plains USD 106, many pupils have graduated and become ideal citizens that represent our school district very well. Tyler Flax, 2005 graduate, is one of those ideal citizens.
Flax was part of the first class to graduate from Western Plains. After high school, he went on to study at Garden City Community College and Fort Hays State University. During his time at both colleges, Flax . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Flax continues to strive after high school

h3.a: Fairbank continues to make an impact

div.p:
RANSOM- There are many employees that make Western Plains a place where everyone feels welcome.
Debbie Fairbank is just one of these employees that helps bring a smile to everyone’s faces.
In the year 2008, there became a position opening at Western Plains in the kitchen. When this came to be, Fairbank applied for the position and eventually wound up getting it. In the beginning, there was some hesitation about . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Fairbank continues to make an impact

h3.a: KAY Club raises $626 for Relay for Life

div.p:
You may recall that back in December, the KAY club teamed up with the Red, White, & Blue Crew to sell live wreaths for a fundraiser.
The Red, White, and Blue Crew is the official team name for the Relay for Life team which is headed by Mrs. Marcia Giess.
The live wreath fundraiser has been going on for several years and is a popular fundraiser because the wreaths are so beautiful, smell so good, and have excellent . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about KAY Club raises $626 for Relay for Life

h3.a: Music teacher selected as recipient of Horizon Award

div.p:
This past month, music teacher Miss Mariannet Navarro Herrera was honored with the Horizon Award, which is given to outstanding first-year teachers.
Herrera joined the Bobcat family in the 2018-2019 school year. She is the music teacher for Western Plains USD 106, instructing band, vocal, and guitar. Since her time as a teacher at Western Plains, the music department has been revived with kids interested in music. . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Music teacher selected as recipient of Horizon Award

div.p:
The following is a link for downloading the Student Handbook.
Student Downloadable Handbook
INTRODUCTION
This book is put together for your use and reference during the school year. It is hoped that you will take pride in your school. To make a school successful requires a positive attitude of its students and faculty, proper conduct, and the cooperation of all involved in it. This handbook will provide you with some guidelines and suggestions for a successful school year. It is asked that you be yourself at your very best at all times, and then success will follow for you and the school.
STAFF
Superintendent / North Principal Jeff Jones
South Principal Rhonda Heim
Counselor Charles Packard
STAFF AT WESTERN PLAINS ELEMENTARY SOUTH AND JUNIOR HIGH
Renee Button Kindergarten, 1st Grade
Amanda Wittman 2nd Grade, 3rd Grade
Renae Nelsen 4th Grade, 5th Grade
Cheryl Rein 6-8 English & Computers
Julie Mauch 6-8 Math & Reading, QPA
Luke Ritchie K-8 Physical Ed., 6-8 Science
Barbara Reinert Music
Kendra Lundgren Special Education . . .

div.p:
Contact information is vital to the success of every alumni association in order to plan the annual Reunion Banquet and to assist graduating classes with their individual reunions. The Ransom-Arnold-Brownell-Western Plains High School Alumni Association has secured a website and an email to help keep everyone linked into the association.
Please go to rabwp.com to register your contact information online and/or email your contact information to RABWclassreunion@hotmail.com.
Don't miss out on the invitations, don't lose contact with old friends. Register with the Alumni Association today.

a.aria-label: Read more about Alumni Contact Information
